meanings.definition: A restriction or control placed on something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher set clear limitations on how much candy the students could eat.
meanings.sent2: There are limitations on how many people can enter the building at once.
meanings.sent3: The limitations on screen time led the kids to discover the joy of playing outside.
meanings.sent4: His fear of failure acted as a heavy limitation on his ability to take risks.
meanings.sent5: The limitations of the old computer became more apparent as technology advanced.

meanings.definition: The act of limiting or the state of being limited.
meanings.sent1: The limitations of the law were clearly outlined in the contract.
meanings.sent2: She felt frustrated by the limitations of her physical strength.
meanings.sent3: The limitations of the budget forced them to get creative with their resources.
meanings.sent4: The limitations of time made it impossible to finish the project before the deadline.
meanings.sent5: The artist embraced the limitations of the small canvas and created a masterpiece.
